Mathematically, it can't get stuck, because we ultimately set `currentAngle` to equal `_position` exactly. The only place `currentAngle` gets modified is in lines 609-616, where it is always either brought closer to `_position` or set exactly equal to `_position`.

I originally had the ending condition of this while loop be `currentAngle == _position`, and that worked perfectly (and it always should, because of line 615), but I changed it to this because comparing for equality between doubles raises compiler warnings which I didn't want to bother explicitly suppressing.

All that being said, it would still be a good idea to stress test this like you're suggesting, just in case someone comes along and modifies this code in a harmful way in the future.
